facts.text: Appellant is manufacturer of Hacksaw blades and Bandsaw Blades falling under Tariff Item No. 51-A iv of the Central Excise Tariff.
Appellant filed classification list as per Rule 173B on 26-3-1985 furnishing tariff rate of 15 ad valorem by mistake instead of effective rates per Notification No. 85/85 CE dated 17-3-1985.
Aggregate value of clearances in preceding year 1984-85 did not exceed Rs. 75 lakhs. Effective rates: first clearance up to Rs. 7.5 lakhs nil; next Rs. 7.5 lakhs at 3.75 ad valorem.
Assistant Collector approved 15 ad valorem rate on 3-6-1985 as appellant did not claim exemption due to ignorance.
Revised classification list with effective rates retrospective from 26-3-1985 filed on 31-10-1985 and approved.
Appellant paid excess Rs. 2,55,172.55 as excise duty from 1-4-1985 to 31-8-1985.
Appellant filed refund application under S. 11B on 30-10-1985.
Assistant Collector sanctioned refund partly on 13-12-1985; rejected claim for 1-4-1985 to 27-4-1985 as time-barred, holding relevant date as date of payment by adjustment in PLA.
RT-12 Return for April 1985 filed on 8-5-1985 and assessed on 29-10-1985.
Order of Assistant Collector confirmed by Collector of Central Excise (Appeals).
Appeal to Customs, Excise and Gold Control Appellate Tribunal dismissed; order dated 15-4-1988.
Classification list filed 26-3-1985 not approved till 3-6-1985; clearances made by debiting PLA, provisional in nature.

legal_issues.text: Starting point of limitation for filing application under S. 11B of Central Excises and Salt Act, 1944, particularly whether clause (e) or (f) of Explanation (B) applies.

petitioner_arguments.text: Mere entry in personal ledger account not starting point for limitation; relevant date is date of assessment of RT-12 returns filed monthly.
Clause (e) of Explanation (B) to S. 11B applies as duty paid provisionally under self-removal procedure pending approval of classification list.

respondent_arguments.text: Relevant date is date of payment of duty by adjustment in personal ledger account.

court_reasoning.text: Payment by debit in personal ledger account under self-removal procedure (Chapter VII-A, Rules 173B, 173C, 173CC, 173F, 173G, 173I) is effective payment, not mere adjustment; initial argument on assessment date under clause (f) not tenable.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Duty paid by debit in PLA reduces deposit; effective payment.

court_reasoning.text: Clearances before approval of classification list (1-4-1985 to 3-6-1985) provisional akin to R.9B procedure (no bond needed due to PLA balance); clause (e) applies, relevant date is adjustment after final assessment (RT-12 assessed 29-10-1985).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Refund claim filed 30-10-1985 within 6 months from assessment date.

holdings.text: Appellant entitled to full refund; no time bar under S.11B as relevant date per clause (e) is date of adjustment after final assessment.

statutes_cited.name: Central Excises and Salt Act, 1944
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs refund claims and appeals; limitation period from relevant date defined in Explanation to S.11B.

statutes_cited.name: Central Excise Rules, 1944
statutes_cited.relevance: Self-removal procedure for provisional clearances pending approval.

statutes_cited.name: Notification No. 85/85 CE
statutes_cited.relevance: Prescribes effective rates of duty based on turnover.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; appellant held entitled to full refund of Rs. 2,55,172.55; no limitation bar as per S.11B clause (e).

key_quotes.text: "Where an assessee maintains a personal ledger account, duty is paid by way of debit therein and goes to reduce the amount of deposit paid by the assessee. It is not a mere adjustment entry it is effective payment."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects petitioner's initial argument on clause (f).

key_quotes.text: "In these circumstances, the clearance of goods made by the appellant between 1st April and 3rd of June, 1985 were in accordance with the procedure for provisional assessment."
key_quotes.speaker: court
court
key_quotes.significance: Final disposition in favor of appellant.
